attributes.action: request that Gordon Brown stops using the plural 'billions' where the singular 'billion' would be more appropriate
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In speeches and policy statements, the Chancellor of the Exchequer often uses the plural 'billions' where most people would consider the singular 'billion' more appropriate, for example when referring to investments of "fifteen billions" or expenditure of "three billions". This is really quite annoying and he should stop it.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
